name: Answers Beginning With 'K' Online Quiz | Alphabetics | 25 Questions

questions.text: Name the marsupial of Australia that lives in eucalyptus trees and eats the leaves.
Name the flightless bird of New Zealand which has a long flexible bill.
Name the sacred book of Islam.
questions.correct: Koran & kuran & kur'an & ku'ran & ko'ran & kor'an
questions.explanation: Koran & kuran & kur'an & ku'ran & ko'ran & kor'an.

questions.text: What is the surname of the American comic silent-film actor who starred in the film, "The General" (1926)?
Name the world's second highest peak also known as Godwin Austen (no hyphen in the answer, please).
What is the surname of the American film actress who retired from the screen after marrying Prince Rainier of Monaco in 1956?
questions.explanation:
Kelly & Grace Kelly.

	Grace Patricia Kelly

questions.text: Name the television programme about the crime fighting adventures of a rebuilt ex-policeman, named Michael Knight, and his talking automobile Kitt.
Which county in the south-east of England has Maidstone as its County Town and which also has Norman cathedrals at Canterbury and Rochester?
What fierce, predatory, black and white, toothed marine mammal, lives in all of the world's oceans, especially in the colder regions?
questions.correct: Killer Whale & orca & orca whale & killer whales & orca whales & orcas
questions.explanation: Killer Whale & orca & orca whale & killer whales & orca whales & orcas.

questions.text: The Greek-American Telly Savalas took on which television role as which New York homicide cop?
What is the second highest mountain in Africa, Mount ______?
questions.explanation:
Kenya.

	Mt Kilimanjaro is the highest.

questions.text: What is the German name for the city of Cologne?
Name the large kingfisher of Australia whose call resembles fiendish laughter.
Name the surname of the classical British violinist, noted for his version of Vivaldi's 'The Four Seasons', Nigel ______.
This country's flag has at its centre the yin-yang symbol which signifies the opposing forces of nature, South _____.
In contrast to Japanese 'Noh drama' which was for the nobility, this was the theatre of the common people.
Which large African antelope found south of the Sahara has a male which bears long, spiral horns?
Name the military religious order who protected routes to Jerusalem for Christians during the Crusades.
questions.correct: Knights Templar & Knights Templars & Knight Templar & Knight Templars
questions.explanation: Knights Templar & Knights Templars & Knight Templar & Knight Templars.

questions.text: Name the former capital of Japan, which lasted as capital for more than a thousand years.
What is the full name of the New Zealand operatic soprano who performed at Prince Charles and Princess Diana's wedding?
Which British group had number one hits with; 'Sunny Afternoon' (1966), 'You Really Got Me' (1964) and 'Tired of Waiting for You' (1965), The ______?
In which television programme did David Carradine play Kwai Chang Caine, a shaven-headed Sino-American Shaolin priest who wandered the Old West in search of his long-lost brother and wisdom?
Which British male vocalist had British hits called 'Everyone's Gone to the Moon' (1965) and 'Una Paloma Blanca' (1975), Jonathan _____?
Name the title of the 1886 book by Robert Louis Stevenson.
Name the surname of the English impresario who originated or refined many influential slapstick routines including the custard pie in the face, Fred ______.
